ai-ud1.4:1.2_0: At one time, when he was first awakened, the Buddha was staying near Uruvelā at the goatherd’s banyan tree on the bank of the Nerañjarā River.
ai-ud1.4:1.3_0: There the Buddha sat cross-legged for seven days without moving, experiencing the bliss of freedom.
ai-ud1.4:1.4_0: When seven days had passed, the Buddha emerged from that state of immersion.
ai-ud1.4:2.1_0: Then a conceited brahmin approached the Buddha,
ai-ud1.4:2.2_0: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he stood to one side.
ai-ud1.4:2.3_0: While standing on one side that brāhmaṇa said this to the Fortunate One:
ai-ud1.4:2.4_0: “Good Gotama, how is one a brahmin? What are the things that make one a brahmin?”
ai-ud1.4:3.1_0: Then, knowing the significance of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ai-ud1.4:4.2_0: Who is humble, free from flaws, and self-controlled,
ai-ud1.4:4.3_0: With perfect understanding, (and) the spiritual life accomplished,
ai-ud1.4:4.4_0: Righteously, without being full of himself,
ai-ud1.4:4.5_0: He may proclaim himself a brahmin.”
